page.title: 05HOUSING STATISTICS IN 1985
page.content: Although much post-war housing in the 50's was well suited to the {affluent retired,}who constitute{60% } of our region's total population, recent limitations have been imposed on further building of this nature. This area has become desireable with an{average price of Â£55,000}and a rateable value of Â£376. Whereas in the west{Larkin}has dominated house design and building, in the middle and eastern areas contractors from out of town have, in recent years, built properties catering more for young {families and the working population, the mean prices being{Â£30,000}and the RV. Â£140, thus creating a different pattern of development. Here too can be found{72%}of Bexhill's 1241{council {properties}of which{22%}are now {owner occupied.
